text:
- So one of the things
(gentle music)
I really love about my job

is that I work across
four different countries.
- I'm part of an EMEA team.
- And I'm based in London.
- A big part of my role

is to understand my
customers' business needs

and help them meet those
using AWS technology.
- We do a lot of work with data science,

big data, artificial intelligence,
and machine learning.
- My customers can be very different.

They can actually be businesses
in the fishing industry

or they can be building
card payment systems
on the blockchain.

- We work with a range
of government customers.

- Working with startups, being
in the startup ecosystem.
- In the same day,

I can be speaking with
a healthcare company.

I could also be talking about
home devices and smart TVs.

- It's a pretty diverse
range of customers.

- The most exciting part
about working here at AWS
is genuinely the team that I work with.

My team helps me grow just
by being there for me.

- You really get to meet
the people in your team,
outside of your team, outside of AWS even.
- I go to universities and schools,

and I like to speak to
students and inspire them
that it is possible coming from uni
to just join such an amazing company

- At AWS, we have a
really good opportunity

to take ownership of
our own pieces of work

and our own initiatives and see
those through to completion.

- If you have a good
idea, you can develop it

and you can own that idea
and make it something big.

- One of the biggest
eye opening things here
is the diversity.

Once again, the amount
of nationalities, races,
ethnicities, and religions we get here
is really, really amazing.
- Diversity allows any organization
to help gain different perspectives

and remove any unconscious
or subconscious bias.

- Diverse people bring diverse
perspectives to challenges,

and we don't want all of
the same types of people
addressing problems in a similar way.
- In my team, I work alongside people
who are coming from multiple backgrounds,
multiple countries, multiple cultures.
It brings fresh ideas.

It allows you really
to take things further
and innovate even more.
- Here at AWS, they're very driven

to make sure that you have a
very good work-life balance.

- I'm able to articulate
what I'm gonna focus,
and I communicate that to my manager.
I say, "Look, this is the time I have.
This is what I need to do.
This is what I'm gonna focus on."
And he says, "Yes, I agree with that."
- At AWS, you are measured by your results
in what you bring to the table,

rather than by the amount
of time that you spend
in front of your screen.
- The culture here is very peculiar.
It's very fast paced.
- So there's always something to explore,
something to learn.

- It's really hard to understand
what it would be like here
until you come to join AWS.
- As long as you have kind of the passion

and the drive to do this,
this job is for you.
(gentle music continues)
